question.text: What is the purpose of the useRef() hook in functional components?

correctAnswer: To create a mutable reference that persists across component renders

question.text: What is the purpose of the useLayoutEffect() hook in functional components?

correctAnswer: To perform side effects synchronously after DOM mutations in functional components

question.text: What is the purpose of the useImperativeHandle() hook in functional components?

correctAnswer: To customize the instance value that is exposed to parent components when using ref

question.text: What are React components?

correctAnswer: Reusable building blocks for UI elements

question.text: What is the purpose of state in React?

correctAnswer: To store and manage component data

question.text: What is the difference between props and state?

correctAnswer: Props are read-only, while state can be modified
incorrectAnswers: Props are used for functional components, while state is used for class components
Props are used for parent-child communication, while state is used for sibling communication
Props are used for data flow from child to parent, while state is used for data flow from parent to child

question.text: What is the purpose of the render() method in React components?

correctAnswer: To return the JSX representation of the component

question.text: What is the significance of keys in React lists?

correctAnswer: To help React identify which items have changed, been added, or been removed
incorrectAnswers: To define the order of items in the list
To apply unique styles to each item in the list
To handle user interactions on list items

question.text: What is the purpose of the componentDidMount() lifecycle method?

correctAnswer: To perform actions after the component has been rendered to the DOM

question.text: What is the purpose of the componentDidUpdate() lifecycle method?

correctAnswer: To perform actions after the component has been updated in the DOM

question.text: What is the purpose of the componentWillUnmount() lifecycle method?

correctAnswer: To perform cleanup actions before the component is removed from the DOM

question.text: What is the purpose of the shouldComponentUpdate() lifecycle method?

correctAnswer: To control whether the component should re-render or not

question.text: What is the purpose of React Router?

correctAnswer: To enable routing and navigation in React applications

question.text: What is the purpose of Redux in React applications?

correctAnswer: To manage global state and enable predictable state management

question.text: What is the purpose of React Native?

correctAnswer: To build native mobile applications using JavaScript and React
incorrectAnswers: To build web applications using JavaScript and React

question.text: What is the purpose of React Hooks?

correctAnswer: To add state and other React features to functional components

correctAnswer: To add state to functional components

correctAnswer: To perform side effects in functional components

question.text: What is the purpose of the useContext() hook?

correctAnswer: To access the value of a context in functional components

correctAnswer: To create a mutable reference that persists across component renders

question.text: What is the purpose of the useCallback() hook?

correctAnswer: To memoize functions and optimize performance in functional components

question.text: What is the purpose of the useMemo() hook?

correctAnswer: To memoize values and optimize performance in functional components

correctAnswer: To manage complex state logic in functional components

correctAnswer: To display a label for custom hooks in React DevTools

question.text: What is the purpose of the React.Fragment component?

correctAnswer: To group multiple elements without adding an extra DOM node

question.text: What is the purpose of the key prop in React?

correctAnswer: To help React identify which items have changed, been added, or been removed in a list

correctAnswer: To insert raw HTML content into a component

correctAnswer: To define the types of props that a component should receive

correctAnswer: To provide default values for props in a component

correctAnswer: To update the component state and trigger a re-render
